    • Method Detail

      • voidFuture

        public static CompletionStage<Void> voidFuture()
        Gets an already completed CompletionStage of Void. This common static instance can be used as an alternative to CompletableFuture.completedFuture(null)

        This has a few advantages:

        • Depending on context, CompletableFuture.completedFuture(null) could either mean a CompletionStage<Void> or an CompletionStage<T>. Using this method clearly indicates that we are returning a void future, not a T future with a null result.
        • Immediately completed null futures are very common. Since they are final and static, we can just reuse a single object and save allocations
        Returns:
        An immediately completed CompletionStage of Void

      • voided

        public static <T> CompletionStage<Void> voided(CompletionStage<T> stage)
        Creates a CompletionStage that completes when stage completes but ignores the result.
        Parameters:
        stage - a non-void CompletionStage
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage of type Void which completes when stage completes

      • errorStage

        public static <T> CompletionStage<T> errorStage(Throwable ex)
        Creates a CompletionStage that is already completed exceptionally. This is the exceptional analog of CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object).
        Parameters:
        ex - the exception that completes the returned stage
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage that has already been completed exceptionally with ex

      • tryWith

        public static <T,R extends AutoCloseable> CompletionStage<T> tryWith(CompletionStage<R> resource,
                                                                     Function<? super R,? extends T> actionUnderResource)
        Performs an action with an asynchronously acquired auto closeable, ensuring that the resource is closed after the action runs. Similar to a try-with-resources block, the resource will be closed even if actionUnderResources throws an exception.

        The returned stage will complete exceptionally in the following scenarios

        1. resource completes exceptionally
        2. actionUnderResource throws an exception
        3. AutoCloseable.close() throws an exception
        Of these cases, only 2 and 3 can happen simultaneously - in this cases, the exception thrown by close will be added to the exception from actionUnderResource as a suppressed exception. If AutoCloseable.close() throws a non-runtime exception, it will be wrapped in a CompletionException.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type of actionUnderResource
        R - the AutoCloseable resource type
        Parameters:
        resource - a CompletionStage that completes with an AutoCloseable
        actionUnderResource - an action to perform that uses result of resource to produce a value
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage that completes with the result of actionUnderResource or completes exceptionally

      • tryComposeWith

        public static <T,R extends AutoCloseable> CompletionStage<T> tryComposeWith(CompletionStage<R> resource,
                                                                            Function<? super R,? extends CompletionStage<T>> actionUnderResource)
        Performs an asynchronous action with an asynchronously acquired AutoCloseable, ensuring that the resource is closed after the stage returned by the action completes. Similar to a try-with-resources block, the resource will be closed even if actionUnderResources throws an exception or if the returned stage completes exceptionally.

        The returned stage will complete exceptionally in the following scenarios

        1. resource completes exceptionally
        2. actionUnderResource throws an exception
        3. actionUnderResource returns an stage that completes exceptionally
        4. AutoCloseable.close() throws an exception
        Of these cases, (2 and 4) and (3 and 4) can happen simultaneously - in these cases, the exception thrown by close will be added to the exception from actionUnderResource as a suppressed exception. If AutoCloseable.close() throws a non-runtime exception, it will be wrapped in a CompletionException.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the CompletionStage produced by actionUnderResource
        R - the AutoCloseable resource type
        Parameters:
        resource - a CompletionStage that completes with an AutoCloseable which will be {AutoCloseable.close() closed} when the stage returned by actionUnderResource completes.
        actionUnderResource - an action to perform that uses result of resource to produce a new CompletionStage
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage that completes with the result of actionUnderResource or completes exceptionally

      • thenComposeOrRecover

        public static <T,U> CompletionStage<U> thenComposeOrRecover(CompletionStage<T> stage,
                                                            BiFunction<? super T,Throwable,? extends CompletionStage<U>> fn)
        Uses the possibly exceptional result of stage to produce a new stage.

        When stage completes, fn will be applied with the result of the stage (or null if it completed exceptionally) and the exception from the stage (or null if it completed normally) to produce a new stage. The returned stage will be completed with the outcome of the stage produced by fn. 

         
 CompletionStage<Integer> backupValue(){...};
 int compute(int i) {
    if (i % 2 == 0)
        return i / 2;
    else
        throw new OddException();
 }
 // get a stage that has the computed value if compute completes normally,
 // or asynchronously computes the backup value otherwise.
 CompletionStage<Optional<Integer>> optionalStage = thenComposeOrRecover(
    () -> CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(compute(myInt)),
    (result, throwable) -> throwable == null ? backupValue() : CompletableFuture.completedOf(result));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type stage
        U - the type of the returned CompletionStage
        Parameters:
        stage - a CompletionStage that may complete exceptionally
        fn - a function that will run with the outcome of stage to produce a new CompletionStage
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage which will complete with the result of fn
        See Also:
        CompletionStage.handle(BiFunction)
